name: Radisson Hotel Duluth-Harborview

reviews.text: I didn't actually stay at the hotel but the restaurant was amazing! the food and the atmosphere, rotating restaurant ! its heaven!
reviews.title: Dining was awesome

reviews.text: All I would say is if you have any valueables don't leave them in your room. House keeping might take them. I left my valueables in my room and call back for them and they have nothing in the last in found. And they are blaming me saying I must have them. But I have check all my bags and I don't have it. I remember leaving it there on my bed. I bet this wasn't the first time nor will it be the last time.
reviews.title: Stolening goods...

reviews.text: Pros.
reviews.title: AOK with me and my Smooth Fox

reviews.text: * Pet Friendly. No upcharge for pets, and they don't stick you in a dud room because you have a pet. Pets know the difference between a scuz hotel vs. upscale. They act more relaxed, it's true. My dog loved this place.
reviews.title: 2 pts. for cleanliness, 5 pts. for the manager = 3.5 pts. overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Good location near city center.
reviews.title: An Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel to Duluth often and have not stayed at the Radisson for a couple of years because of past experiences of mediocrity. When I stayed a little less than two weeks ago for the night, it was the result of a Hotwire booking. I can confidently say this hotel does not meet the standards of a Hotwire three-star hotel...
reviews.title: Bit of a facelift, but same old Radisson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing that is clear to me is that the Radisson has taken some measures to attempt to improve their image and customer satisfaction. I think it will become obvious that the word "attempt" is key here. The Lobby has been re-designed, as has the main level bar and top of the hotel restaurant. However, beyond that, it's the same old Radisson. Personally, I can't figure out why so much time was spent on improving aspects of a hotel that are of so little consequence during a stay. I don't know about you, but I tend to spend most of my time in a hotel in the room (and sleeping). A fashionable lobby is a nice touch, but certainly not instrumental in my decision to stay at a particular hotel.
reviews.title: So many better options nearby!

reviews.text: Personally, when I stay at a hotel, I care primarily about the condition of the room - bed comfort, room cleanliness, appropriate water pressure/volume, room appearance, amenities, etc. It is here where the Radisson fails - the aspects of a hotel stay that are important to most travelers. The rooms are quite outdated: the Sleep Number beds are ancient, the decor...everything - they're just not enough to compete with the many other properties in the area.
reviews.title: I would never stay here again

reviews.text: I didn't have the pleasure of investigating the pool area this time around. However, the fitness room is basically a death trap. Be careful if you use that multi-purpose machine for weightlifting.
reviews.title: Older hotel...but Radisson Corporate did respond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were much-improved in decor. The main level bar had a nice pub atmosphere and excellent service. I had a nice local beer which was brewed a few blocks away. SImilarly, the restaurant at the top had great food, service, and a beautiful view of the lake/city. My fiancee and I enjoyed some tasty omelettes there. Of course, the restaurant still rotates at the top. This gimmick is a nice novelty for some, although those experiencing the effects of a night on the town may want to steer clear.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.text: A busy hotel, that seems to overwhelm the staff a bit. On my arrival, there were 10 people lined up waiting to check-in and only one staff person available to help. At around 3pm the rooms weren't always ready, so a number of groups were also milling around the lobby wondering what to do. Then the airline staff arrived and that further confused things.
reviews.title: Generally OK, but a bit run down

reviews.text: The room I got was fine, nothing special. It overlooked the back of the hotel and had security bars on the window (which could open). The air-conditioner was rattling and clanking and trying its best to keep up. The carpet had a few stains and there was a distinct cigarette smell in the bathroom even though this was a non-smoking room. Lots of plumbing noises from other rooms, too.
reviews.title: Lobby is modern, Rooms are dreadful

reviews.text: Located between the Duluth library and the County Courthouse, this is a reasonably well located downtown hotel. Lots of vacant storefronts in the immediate neighborhood, but a short walk to good eating and drinking options. (Try Pizza Luce, about five blocks away.) On the outside, it is clearly from another decade - and is now quite ugly. The parking situation is tight and can easily fill up. There's lots of signs warning you not to leave valuables in your vehicle.
reviews.title: RUN!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is just fine and the location is great – walking distance from the lake. It seems the hotel is in the middle of renovations and started with the lobby – which they use for marketing. The lobby is ultra modern – very neat layout. However, when you go up to the hotel floors, it dates back a few decades. Our room was good in size, large enough for 4 people. This hotel has Sleep Number beds – This was exciting because of all the rave reviews for Sleep Number beds. I am not a fan – it was like sleeping on a air mattress with no support. The bathroom toilet sounds like a airplane taking off when flushed – we were all so nervous flushing in the middle of the night. TV is old school with a horrible connection – no DVD player to watch movies at night. Overall, this hotel is 2.5 out of 5. If they continue with the updates, I can assume it will be fabulous!
reviews.title: Very unhelpful & completely unresponsive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, we also went up to the restaurant/ bar for jazz night. Only 8 places to sit – they had closed the rest of the restaurant. So, if you got there before the jazz music started, you have a great seat. Otherwise they send you downstairs to their other bar with no music or windows to view the lake.
reviews.title: Desperately needs capital improvements

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I got a bit nervous. People sure are picky. Basically my husband and I wanted a place to sleep after a day/night in Duluth. I really like Duluth we live an hour and fifteen minutes away.
reviews.title: Nice stay
nice place to stay,,,,and ""outstanding"" food in the upper restaurant,,,,
reviews.text: Great staff, comfy bed, nice view, great location and would stay at the Radisson again.

wow,,,we had the best food in the sky restaurant,,,we love good food,,,,and this could not be beat,,,and we r used to high end spots,,,the jazz band nice,,,and the wait staff was super as well...Don't pass this up,,, for good food,,,and atmosphere,,,,,u will be satisfied...cp
reviews.title: Bad choice for a stay

reviews.text: Was excited for the stay, but sadly disappointed. I had reserved 2 rooms with king beds and ended up with 1 room with 2 full beds. Not a big deal really, however the staff was not helpful at all. When I expressed concern about the room, I was told "I only give out the rooms they mark down for me in the morning". The check out process was the same ... no one asked "how was your stay?" or a said simple "Thank you". They just asked what credit card I wanted to use and never even looked up from the counter. One other note ... the skyway system is dissolate and run down. Find another one of the hotels in Duluth, you will be much happier!
reviews.title: very nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four of us went to Duluth for an overnight not knowing where to stay, we picked this. The staff was helpful, the rooms very nice and clean. One of the sleep number beds was not working, we called and someone was up right away to fix it.
reviews.title: Great Service and rooms with the best view

description: Duluth's landmark hotel located in the heart of Downtown Duluth. Featuring Sleep Number beds from Select Comfort, indoor pool, whirlpool, sauna and newly renovated fitness center. Enjoy relaxing by the fireplace in the newly renovated lobby. Also enjoy the only 360 degree rotating restaurant JJ Astor located on the top floor of the hotel.
